013package org.apache.juneau.svl.vars;
014
015import java.util.regex.*;
016
017import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
019
020/**
021 * A basic switch/case logic variable resolver.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * The format for this var is one of the following:
025 * <ul>
026 *    <li><js>"$SW{stringArg, pattern:thenValue[, pattern:thenValue...]}"</js>
027 *    <li>...
028 * </ul>
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * The pattern can be any string optionally containing <js>'*'</js> or <js>'?'</js> representing any or one character
032 * respectively.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
035 * <p class='bjava'>
036 *    <jc>// Create a variable resolver that resolves system properties and $SW vars.</jc>
037 *    VarResolver <jv>varResolver</jv> = VarResolver.<jsm>create</jsm>().vars(SwitchVar.<jk>class</jk>, SystemPropertiesVar.<jk>class</jk>).build();
038 *
039 *    <jc>// Use it!</jc>
040 *    System.<jsf>out</jsf>.println(<jv>varResolver</jv>.resolve(<js>"We are running on $SW{$P{os.name},*win*:Windows,*:Something else}!"</js>));
041 * </p>
042 *
043 * <p>
044 * Since this is a {@link MultipartVar}, any variables contained in the result will be recursively resolved.
045 * <br>Likewise, if the arguments contain any variables, those will be resolved before they are passed to this var.
046 *
047 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
048 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SimpleVariableLanguageBasics">Simple Variable Language Basics</a>
049 * </ul>
050 */
051public class SwitchVar extends MultipartVar {
052
053   /** The name of this variable. */
054   public static final String NAME = "SW";
055
056   /**
057    * Constructor.
058    */
059   public SwitchVar() {
060      super(NAME);
061   }
062
063   @Override /* MultipartVar */
064   public String resolve(VarResolverSession session, String[] args) {
065      Utils.assertArg(args.length >= 2, "Invalid number of arguments passed to $SW var.  Must have 2 or more arguments.");
066
067      String stringArg = args[0];
068      for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
069         String pattern = args[i];
070
071         String[] parts = Utils.splita(pattern, ':', 2);
072         Utils.assertArg(parts.length >= 2, "Invalid arguments passed to $SW var.  Each case statement must contains 'pattern:value'.");
073
074         Pattern p = Pattern.compile(parts[0].replace("*", ".*").replace("?", "."));
075         if (p.matcher(stringArg).matches())
076            return parts[1];
077      }
078
079      // Nothing matched and no else clause.
080      return "";
081   }
082}
